greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of n*(k+1)-step k-dimensional nonnegative closed lattice walks starting at the origin and using steps that increment all components or decrement one component by 1; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..24, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, (k-> add(
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, 1, Function[k, Sum[
If[l[[i]]>0, b[n-1, Sort[ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]]-1]]], 0], {i, 1, k}]+
If[Sum[i, {i, l}] + k < n, b[n - 1, Map[#+1&, l]], 0]][Length[l]]];
Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 26 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 12 2021
